intro: Volutaria abyssinica subsp. abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian volutaria, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
